intro: Pellionia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf pellionia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Pellionia macrophylla is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
